intro: Dalechampia tenuiramea, commonly known as the slender-leaved dalechampia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers that are often surrounded by colorful bracts. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
